instruction: The input is taken from a negotiation between two participants who take the role of campsite neighbors and negotiate for Food, Water, and Firewood packages, based on their individual preferences and requirements. Given an utterance and recent dialogue context containing past 3 utterances (wherever available), output Yes if the utterance contains the elicit-pref strategy, otherwise output No. elicit-pref is a cooperative negotiation strategy. It is used to discover the preference order of the opponent in the negotiation.
input:
Context: 'I could give you 1 water for 1 firewood, most of my firewood got wet so is almost useless . Would you perhaps except some food for another unit of firewood?' 'Oh. Let do some deal. If you give me all water bottles I will give you 2 firewood. Can you accept this' 'i could give you 2 water bottles and 3 food if you can do 3 firewood'
Utterance: 'OK. Are you need Extra food packages?'

instruction: The input is taken from a negotiation between two participants who take the role of campsite neighbors and negotiate for Food, Water, and Firewood packages, based on their individual preferences and requirements. input:
Context: 'Hello I need a lot of water to survive' 'I have a lot of water around me I can use. So I can give you a lot of extra.' 'Ok nice I will give you 3 food if you give me 3 water'
Utterance: 'OK, that works for me. But I would like a lot of firewood. I like to hunt and cook what I kill.'
